high.mackenzie.autumn.util

Class T

  • java.lang.Object
    • high.mackenzie.autumn.util.T

  • public final class T
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides commonly used static utility methods.

    This class has a single letter name, because it will be used very frequently. As a result, the shorter name saves Autumn programmers some typing.

    • Method Detail

      • rethrow

        public static void rethrow(java.lang.Throwable problem)
        This method rethrows an exception quietly.

        If the exception is checked, then it will be wrapped in a CheckedException object and then rethrown; otherwise, the exception will simply be rethrown immediately.

        Parameters:
        problem - is the exception to rethrow.

      • apply

        public static java.lang.Object apply(TypedFunctor functor,
                     java.lang.Iterable<?> arguments)
                              throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method applies a functor to a list of arguments.
        Parameters:
        functor - is the functor itself.
        arguments - are the arguments to apply the functor to.
        Returns:
        the result of applying the functor to the arguments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if functor is null.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if arguments is null.
        java.lang.Throwable - in order to propagate any exceptions thrown by the functor.

      • printf

        public static void printf(java.lang.String format,
          java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object> args)
        This method prints a formated string to standard-output.

        This is simply a convenience method on top of PrintStream's printf(String, Object[]).

        Parameters:
        format - is the format specifier.
        args - are the arguments to substitute into the format string.

        Parameters:

        args - are the arguments to substitute into the format string.

      • range

        public static java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> range(int start,
                                          int end,
                                          int step)
        This method creates an iterable that iterates over the integers in a discrete range.
        Parameters:
        start - is the inclusive lowest value in the range.
        end - is the inclusive highest value in the range.
        step - is the distance that elements in the range are separated for one another.
        Returns:
        a lazy list of integers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if end is less-than start.

      • iter

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Boolean> iter(boolean[] array)
        This method creates an iterator over a given array of booleans.

        The returned iterator will not support the remove() method.

        Parameters:
        array - is the array itself.
        Returns:
        an iterable whose iterator can iterate over the given array.

      • defaultValue

        public static java.lang.Object defaultValue(java.lang.Class type)
        This method returns the default value of a given type.

        The boolean type returns false.
        Numeric types return zero.
        Reference types return null.

        Parameters:
        type - is the type that indicates the value to return.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the type is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is the void-type.

      • unique

        public static java.math.BigInteger unique()
        This method never returns the same BigInteger twice.
        Returns:
        a new unique positive integer.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.Comparable left,
          java.lang.Comparable right)
        This method compares to comparable values.

        A result of negative one indicates that the left operand is less than the right operand. A result of positive one indicates that the left operand is greater than the right operand. A zero result indicates that the operands are equal.

        This method considers null to be less than an object.

        Parameters:
        left - is the left operand.
        right - is the right operand.
        Returns:
        an integer that represents the relationship between the operands.

      • sum

        public static java.math.BigDecimal sum(java.lang.Iterable<?> values)
        This method calculates the sum of a set of values.
        Parameters:
        values - are the values to sum.
        Returns:
        the sum of the values.

        the average of the values.

      • any

        public static boolean any(java.lang.Iterable<?> values,
          Predicate condition)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method determines whether any of the values in an iterable match a predicate.
        Parameters:
        values - are the values to check.
        condition - is the condition that may match one of the values.
        Returns:
        true, iff at least one of the values matches the predicate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

        This method determines whether all of the values in an iterable match a predicate.

        condition - is the condition that may match the values.
        Returns:
        true, iff all of the values match the predicate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • count

        public static int count(java.lang.Iterable<?> values,
        Predicate condition)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method counts the the values that match a predicate
        Parameters:
        values - are the values to check.
        condition - is the condition that may match some of the values.
        Returns:
        the number of values (may be zero) that match the predicate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • map

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> map(java.lang.Iterable iterable,
                                   Function1 function)
                                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method applies a functor to each element of an iterable and collects the results.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable that provides input for the functor.
        function - is the functor(Object) : Object that processes the input.
        Returns:
        an immutable list containing the output of the functor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in order to allow exceptions to propagate from the functor.

      • sorted

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable> java.util.List<T> sorted(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable)
        This method creates a sorted list from an unsorted iterable.

        If an in-place sort is preferred, consider using method sort(List) in class java.util.Collections.

        Parameters:
        iterable - provides the elements for the new sorted list.
        Returns:
        a sorted list that contains the elements of the given input iterable.

      • sorted

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> sorted(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                           java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        This method creates a sorted list from an unsorted iterable.

        If an in-place sort is preferred, consider using method sort(List) in class java.util.Collections.

        Parameters:
        iterable - provides the elements for the new sorted list.
        comparator - is a function object that can compare elements of the iterable.
        Returns:
        a sorted list that contains the elements of the given input iterable.

        public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.CharSequence string)

        Returns:
        the modified string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if string is null.

        Parameters:

      • str

        public static java.lang.String str(java.lang.Iterable<?> iterable,
                   java.lang.String prefix,
                   java.lang.String separator,
                   java.lang.String suffix)
        This method creates a string representation for an iterable.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable itself.
        prefix - is a string to prepend onto the result.
        separator - is the substring used to separate elements in the result.
        suffix - is a string to append onto the result.
        Returns:
        the aforedescribed result.

      • str

        public static java.lang.String str(java.util.Map<?,?> map,
                   java.lang.String prefix,
                   java.lang.String assign,
                   java.lang.String separator,
                   java.lang.String suffix)
        This method creates a string representation for a map.
        Parameters:
        map - is the map itself.
        prefix - is a string to prepend onto the result.
        assign - is the substring to place between keys and values in the result.
        seperator - is the substring used to separate key-value-pairs from each other in the result.
        suffix - is a string to append onto the result.
        Returns:
        the aforedescribed result.

      • sync

        public static void sync(java.lang.Object locked,
        Action body)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method synchronizes the invocation of a functor.
        Parameters:
        locked - is the object to obtain a lock on.
        body - is the functor to invoke.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an exception is thrown by the functor.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the functor is non-nullary.

      • clear

        public static <T extends Record> T clear(T self)
        This method sets the value of each element to its default value.

        This method does not affect the special-method bindings.

        Returns:
        this object, if this record is mutable; otherwise, return a modified copy thereof.

      • set

        public static <T extends Record> T set(T self,
                       java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.Object value)
        This method assigns a new value to a specific element.

        Auto-unboxing will be performed, if necessary. However, the unboxed value will not be auto-widened.

        This is a linear-time operation in the worst case.

        Parameters:
        key - is the name of the element to assign the value to.
        value - is the new value.
        Returns:
        this object, if this record is mutable; otherwise, return a modified copy thereof.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the key does not refer to an actual element.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object is not of an acceptable type.

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get(Record self,
                   java.lang.String key)
        This method retrieves the value of a specific element.

        This is a linear-time operation in the worst case.

        Parameters:
        key - is the name of the element to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the value of the element.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the key is null.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no element is identified by the given key.

      • isSubset

        public static boolean isSubset(Record subtype,
               Record supertype)
        This method determines whether the set of entries in one record is a subset of the records in another record.
        Parameters:
        subtype - is the possible subset record.
        supertype - is the possible superset record.
        Returns:
        true, if subtype.keys() is a subset of supertype.keys().

        public static void set(java.lang.Throwable problem,
       java.lang.String key,
       java.lang.Object value)
        This method associates a detail with a given exception.
        Parameters:
        problem - is the exception that the detail is in reference to.
        key - identifies the detail.
        value - is the content of the detail.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if problem is null.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key is null.

      • get

        public static java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Throwable problem,
                   java.lang.String key)
        This method retrieves a detail that is associated with a given exception.
        Parameters:
        problem - is the exception that the detail is in reference to.
        key - identifies the detail.
        Returns:
        the value of the detail, or null, if the detail does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if problem is null.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if key is null.

      • big

        public static java.math.BigDecimal big(java.lang.Object value)
        This method converts a value to a BigDecimal.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to convert.
        Returns:
        the value as a BigDecimal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if value is null.

      • enumerate

        public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> enumerate(java.lang.Iterable<?> iterable)
        This method creates a list of [index, element] pairs.
        Parameters:
        iterable - provides the elements.
        Returns:
        the list of [index, element] pairs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if iterable is null.

      • async

        public static AsyncTask async(Action action)

                     java.lang.Class X)

                  java.lang.Class supertype)
